The central paper presents a multiple kernel learning approach for anomaly detection in aviation safety data, integrating discrete and continuous parameters. Neighboring papers focus on outlier detection (LOF, LPF, density tests), clustering (TRACLUS, BIRCH, projected clustering), and real-time data processing (Aurora, online novelty detection), collectively highlighting advanced techniques in anomaly identification, clustering efficiency, and stream processing for safety and monitoring applications.

The XSB system is a high-performance, in-memory deductive database engine based on Prolog, enhanced with tabling and flexible data modeling via HiLog, while the Glue-Nail system combines declarative and procedural languages for optimized performance in database queries and non-query tasks.

The central paper demonstrates vulnerabilities in 802.11 networks to RF interference and proposes channel hopping as a mitigation strategy, while neighboring papers discuss wireless routing protocols (VRR, COPE), network fairness (AFA, IQU), spectrum efficiency (Net7, Ganache), rate adaptation (CHARM), interference modeling, and hardware-specific solutions (PARADIS), collectively highlighting diverse approaches to improving wireless network robustness, throughput, and efficiency across MAC/PHY layers.
The central paper demonstrates analog network coding's capacity benefits, while neighboring papers discuss wireless network capacity bounds, localization schemes, throughput estimation, TDMA scheduling, secure routing, WLAN traffic analysis, rate adaptation, channel access protocols, full-duplex transceivers, proactive routing, WWAN optimizations, monitoring tools, neighbor discovery, QoS scheduling, and fairness optimization in multi-hop networks.
The paper introduces Partial Packet Recovery (PPR) combining SoftPHY and a postamble scheme with PP-ARQ, showing 2x capacity gains in wireless mesh networks, alongside related advancements in wireless routing (ETX), MIMO protocols (Contrabass), capacity analysis, proactive routing, infrastructure trade-offs, pTCP, simultaneous transmissions, network stability, network coding (XOR-Sym), ZigZag decoding, I3 overlay, TCP Westwood, SAM for WLANs, inter-link correlation (κ), and fairness in backhaul networks.
